titles.title: Department of Homeland Security Mentor-Protégé Program Act of 2019
Department of Homeland Security Mentor-Protégé Program Act of 2019
Department of Homeland Security Mentor-Protégé Program Act of 2019
Department of Homeland Security Mentor-Protege Program Act of 2019
Department of Homeland Security Mentor-Protégé Program Act of 2019
To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish a mentor-protégé program, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Homeland Security.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Homeland Security. H. Rept. 116-310.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 251.

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.
Ms. Slotkin moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4727.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Johnson with amendments. With written report No. 116-287.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 579.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary:
Department of Homeland Security Mentor-Protege Program Act of 2019
This bill provides statutory authority for the mentor-protégé program of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) under which a mentor firm enters into an agreement with a protégé firm to assist the latter to compete for prime contracts and subcontracts of DHS.
